Articles.Content:
Oi mates and babes. Im going to post my drawings of spacecraft idea's here, feel free to rate my ideas! this is my first one: (Those are not KSP related, but IRL related lol)

The drawing explains itself.

Edited August 25, 2016 by NSEP

I will be posting more, hopefully.

I moved it somewhere else.

Edited August 20, 2016 by NSEP

I changed it to IDEAS, not designs anymore.

Edited August 21, 2016 by NSEP

53 minutes ago, NSEP said:

That is probably my worst example,

Why don't you show us your best example? There is no point is talking about something you yourself think is bad.

I don't intend to be rude, but this is little more than a scribble in a notebook someone draws when bored during a lecture.

If you want to actually design something, you need to put some math behind this. Figure out the mission requirements, then figure out what the supporting equipment is. Once you have the mass of the mission stuff, figure out the enclosure for it. Find a realistic engine and then you can work out how much fuel you need. Just drawing boxes and labeling them is not designing.

Edited August 20, 2016 by Shpaget

49 minutes ago, Shpaget said:

Why don't you show us your best example? There is no point is talking about something you yourself think is bad.

I don't intend to be rude, but this is little more than a scribble in a notebook someone draws when bored during a lecture.

If you want to actually design something, you need to put some math behind this. Figure out the mission requirements, then figure out what the supporting equipment is. Once you have the mass of the mission stuff, figure out the enclosure for it. Find a realistic engine and then you can work out how much fuel you need. Just drawing boxes and labeling them is not designing.

Yes, i have a that in my better desings, but my better ones were not posted on the internet, and posting things via iphone to the internet is harder than you think, thats why.

Here is my better Lunar Ascent Vehicle. Does not have everything, but its not just box.

Better @Shpaget?
To science and geeky subforum.
I like to do the math behind it, but I'm not keen on drawing.

18 minutes ago, Bill Phil said:

http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/keen

Ok, i really like the drawings and i really hate the math, even though it is very important. Sorry got bad English.
That seems pretty darn tall for a Lunar lander rather than a Munar one. What do you plan to do to help stabilize it?
Redundant threads have been merged.

2 hours ago, Maximus97 said:

That seems pretty darn tall for a Lunar lander rather than a Munar one. What do you plan to do to help stabilize it?

 

It is not that tall right? The wide landing gears could save it. And internal struts so the spacecraft does not wobble like jelly.

Edited August 21, 2016 by NSEP
Well no, it's not very tall, it's just taller than it is wide. The LM was about 31 feet (~9.5m) wide, but only 23 feet (~7m) tall. Being taller than it is wide would mean it could tip more easily.

7 hours ago, Maximus97 said:

Well no, it's not very tall, it's just taller than it is wide. The LM was about 31 feet (~9.5m) wide, but only 23 feet (~7m) tall. Being taller than it is wide would mean it could tip more easily.

It could tip easier yeah, but if you land carefull enough you wont tip, please note that it is my absolute WORST example, look at the newer one instead it is a lunar ascent vehicle, but i can still do better than that.

I don't intend to be rude, but this is little more than a scribble in a notebook someone draws when bored during a lecture.

If you want to actually design something, you need to put some math behind this. Figure out the mission requirements, then figure out what the supporting equipment is. Once you have the mass of the mission stuff, figure out the enclosure for it. Find a realistic engine and then you can work out how much fuel you need. Just drawing boxes and labeling them is not designing.

Ok, thanks for the tip, but now I changed the page a bit. Under the image i said that you should not judge my worst one, and since the page got merged with my original page, it is now IDEAS, not designs.
Here is my MCT concept:
I really like the little drawing on the top corner of it, looks really cool!

23 hours ago, Pine said:

I really like the little drawing on the top corner of it, looks really cool!

Thanks, i got a new pencil wich has a harder tip. This makes my drawings with shadows and landscape it look a bit realistic and a bit sketchy. I do really like it too. I think im going to draw one in all of my spacecraft ideas, just so people know what it is going to look like for real. It also was not too hard to draw for me i thought it was just a funny scribble. Glad you like it!
